interestingFact: Japan has the world’s oldest continuous monarchy, which dates back over 1,500 years.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which is the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
France is the world's most visited country, attracting millions of tourists every year.
India is home to the world’s largest democracy and the birthplace of major religions such as Hinduism and Buddhism.
Russia is the largest country in the world, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (administrative), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Egypt is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, the Great Pyramid of Giza.
The United States is made up of 50 states, and each state has its own distinct culture and laws.
